intro: Solanum vulgatum var. chlorocarpum, commonly known as the green-fruited nightshade, is a variant of the common nightshade plant. It is a herbaceous annual plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with simple, alternate leaves that are ovate to lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are usually white or pale purple, and the fruits are distinctive for their bright green color when mature. This variety is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
